intro: Psychotria vaccinioides, commonly known as the "vaccinioides psychotria," is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white or greenish-white flowers. It produces small, red berries that are often consumed by birds, aiding in seed dispersal. Psychotria vaccinioides is also noted for its potential ethnobotanical uses in traditional medicine.
